title: DELTONA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
JAZZ: CLARK TERRY'S QUINTET
description: A new jazz club, the Blue Note, has opened in the long, narrow room at 131 West Third Street, once occupied by a ''Mediterranean restaurant'' called David's Harp. The Blue Note's focus is on contemporary mainstream jazz performers.

title: Van Patten Wins Again
description: Unseeded Vince Van Patten upset topseeded John McEnroe, 6-3, 7-5, today in the semifinals of the $300,000 Seiko tennis tournament. It was Van Patten's third upset victory; he beat third-seeded Jose-Luis Clerc in the second round and fifth-seeded Vitas Gerulaitis in the quarterfinals.

title: DOMTAR INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After $4.8 million charge...C-Including $3.4 million special gain; yr-ago results have been restated for an accounting change; the company is also listed on the Montreal and Toronto stock exchanges

title: HARTFORD STEAM BOILER INSPECTION & INSURAN reports earnings for Qtr to Sep
RESEARCHERS DISPUTE EZRA POUND'S 'INSANITY'
description: A historian and a psychiatrist, acting independently, have taken a new view of the circumstances that led to Ezra Pound's hospital confinement rather than trial for treason after World War II.

title: STAR-GLO INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After $28,000 reversal of tax benefit; yr-ago results restated for the merger of Tec Torch Co into Star-Glo on Jan 23 as a pooling of interest

title: Patents; Donald J. Quigg Sworn
description: Donald J. Quigg, who was nominated by President Reagan to be Deputy Commissioner of Patents and Trademarks, was sworn in this week and took over as second in command to Commissioner Gerald J. Mossinghoff. Mr. Quigg served in the Patent Division of Phillips Petroleum from 1945 until his retirement last year.

title: Patents; A Method for Carving Jack-o'-Lanterns
description: Jack-o'-lanterns are traditionally made for display on Halloween. By coincidence, Christopher A. Nauman of Frederick, Md., was granted a patent this week for his method of forming them from pumpkins and for the tools to be used in shaping their facial features.

title: LURIA, L, & SON reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
IDAHO POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Around the Nation; Wife Acquitted in Death Of a Politician in Texas
description: A judge acquitted Vickie Daniel today of murdering her husband, Price Daniel Jr., the former Speaker of the Texas House.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''The President is in excellent health. His blood pressure, pulse, and respiratory functions are normal.

title: INMATES HOLDING HOSTAGES FIRE SHOTS IN PENNSYLVANIA
description: A ''pellet'' fired from inside a prison area where four convicts are holding 38 hostages, bruised a patrolman's ankle, the state police reported today. More than 100 armed officers were standing by as the vigil entered its third day.

title: WOLOHAN LUMBER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Workers Buy A G.M. Plant
description: A new company formed by workers today purchased the New Departure-Hyatt Bearing Division factory from the General Motors Corporation.

title: Sports People; Guerrero Going?
description: Newspaper reports in San Diego quote sources ''close to the Los Angeles organization'' as saying that the Dodgers are considering trading Pedro Guerrero, a co-winner of the most-valuable-player award in the World Series, and two pitchers to the Padres for the shortstop Ozzie Smith. Another version held that the Padres wanted a ''quality'' pitcher in exchange for Smith but did not mention Guerrero. The Dodgers are known to be ready to break up their infield, and a player considered likely to go is their current shortstop, Bill Russell. ... Steve Braun, a star of the 1970's in the American League, was sent to the minor leagues as the St. Louis Cardinals cut their winter roster to 38.

title: SAUDIS TO REDUCE OIL OUTPUT
description: Sheik Ahmed Zaki Yamani, Saudi Arabia's oil minister, said today that his country would reduce its oil output - apparently by more than 500,000 barrels a day - to a maximum of 8.5 million barrels daily.

title: New Computer Systems by Exxon
description: The Exxon Corporation, whose move into the automated office has floundered badly, partly for lack of new products, introduced two new desktop computerized ''work stations.''

title: GRAHAM MANUFACTURING CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After foreign currency translation losses of $344,000 for the qr and $568,000 for the 9 mos...C-Net income

title: Rev. Dr. W. J. Boney, Church Council Aide
description: The Rev. Dr. William Jerry Boney, a minister in the Presbyterian Church in the U.S. who was head of the Faith and Order Commission for the National Council of Churches, died of cancer Wednesday night at his home in Fanwood, N.J. He was 50 years old.

title: PARING U.S. AID IS NO HELP TO IMAGE OF STABILITY
description: To the Editor:

title: People; Teen-Age Actress Battling Leukemia
description: Shelley Bruce, the 16-year-old former star of the Broadway musical ''Annie,'' is under treatment for acute lymphoblastic leukemia, the most common form of childhood leukemia.

title: Patents; A Home That Will Float Or Fly or Just Sit There
description: There are mobile homes and there are mobile homes, but nowhere, surely, is there one quite like Presley O. Barge's mobile home. Mr. Barge, a St. Louis railroad man, has patented a spherical structure which, he says, can rest on the ground or float on water or be moved through space.

title: PUERTO RICAN CEMENT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest period sales include $582,000 of revs from realty operations compared with $1,040,000 a yr ago

title: FIDELITY FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Net income...C-Includes a nonrecurring gain of $6,225,000

title: Ramada Posts Loss
description: Ramada Inns said today that it lost $38.4 million in the third quarter, in contrast to net income of $6 million, or 22 cents a share, a year earlier. Ramada also said it would report a loss for the full year. Third-quarter revenues climbed 11.3 percent, to $110.2 million from $99 million.

title: The Emperor's New Tax Cut
description: Though the occasion attracted little attention, the Reagan Administration last week unveiled the final, and most miraculous, phase of its economic plan for the country.

title: Around the Nation; Crew of 8 Killed in Crash Of B-52 Training Flight
description: An Air Force B-52 crashed into the southeastern Colorado prairie today, killing all eight crew members.

title: FICTIONAL COME-AS-YOU-WISH-YOU-WERE PARTY
description: The Elephant Man was there, chatting with Dorian Gray. Count Dracula met Huckleberry Finn, and the Invisible Man met the Invisible Woman.

title: POLISH CHIEF ASKS AID OF PARLIAMENT TO STOP WALKOUTS
description: Gen. Wojciech Jaruzelski, the Prime Minister and Communist Party leader, asked Parliament today to appeal for an end to strikes. He warned that if the strikes did not cease the Government was prepared to seek a law forbidding them.

title: Delay Likely in Hinckley Trial
description: The trial of John W. Hinckley Jr. on charges of trying to kill President Reagan is not likely to begin until January, Justice Department sources said today. Federal District Judge Barrington Parker had set Nov. 30 for the start of the trial. But the sources said he was likely to agree with a request by Government prosecutors to postpone the trial.

title: TALLEY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Yr-ago qr and 6 mos include sales of $37.3 million and pre-tax income of $3.3 million applicable to the July 1980 sale of Arrowhead Ranch property

title: MUSIC: FOSS'S MODERNS
description: There was a big crowd on hand Thursday at the Brooklyn Academy of Music for the seasonal opening of Lukas Foss's Meet the Moderns series, probably lured by the concert's inclusion in the academy's Next Wave series. One wonders what all the neophytes thought. As usual, there was an overarching concept to the programming, effective performances and Mr. Foss's earnest, helpful, clumsy ''discussions'' with the composers. Unfortunately, there didn't seem to be much really gripping music.

title: DOCTOR TESTIFIES ABOUT HIS EFFORTS TO CONTROL PRESLEY'S USE OF DRUGS
description: Dr. George Nichopoulos took the witness stand today in his own defense and flatly denied criminal charges that he overprescribed controlled drugs to Elvis Presley, Jerry Lee Lewis and seven other patients. He asserted that his healing duties as a physician were always uppermost in his mind.

title: Loss at Schlitz
description: The Jos. Schlitz Brewing Company, the nation's fourth-largest brewer, reported a loss in the third quarter of $36.1 million, attributed mainly to the $43.2 million cost of closing a Milwaukee brewery.

title: AVIATION PIONEER
description: Walter Hinton, an aviation pioneer who was a member of a six-man crew that flew a Navy plane across the Atlantic Ocean eight years before Lindbergh, died Wednesday in the Colonial Palms Nursing Home here. He was 92 years old.

title: Daniel Lynch, Ex-Coach, Dies
description: Daniel J. Lynch, former athletic director and basketball coach at St. Francis College in Brooklyn, died yesterday at the Memorial Sloane Kettering Cancer Center. He was 65 years old.

title: AVX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
SOUTHLAND ROYALTY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
GIANTS-JETS TICKET IS HOTTEST IN TOWN
description: Mark Gastineau's mother will stay at his Long Island home tomorrow, even though she came all the way from the family ranch in Oklahoma to see her son play football for the Jets.

title: Bridge; U.S. WINS BERMUDA BOWL, BUT WOMEN'S TEAM LOSES
description: Compensating for the loss of the world's women's team title last night, the United States won another title here this afternoon when the world team championships concluded.

title: JUDGE ORDERS WRITER TO TESTIFY
description: Douglas S. Looney, the author of a Sports Illustrated article in which a Government informant told of a scheme to shave points in Boston College basketball games, will be required to appear as a defense witness at the Federal trial of five persons accused of having participated in the scheme.

title: WALCO NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Latest qr results include Standard Alliance Industries in the process of being merged into Walco National Corp

title: Farmer Paces Princeton To Heptagonal Victory
description: Matt Farmer, a 20-year-old political science major from Princeton, finished first, and four of his teammates finished among the first nine yesterday as Princeton won the Heptagonal cross-country championships for the sixth time in the last seven years.

title: Around the Nation; Duke Faculty Endorses Action on Nixon Library
description: The Duke University faculty recommended yesterday that the school proceed with negotiations for a Richard M. Nixon Presidential library, but that it drop plans for a proposed museum.

title: MIAMI OFFICIAL CALLS ATHLETIC RULES LAX
description: Excellent higher education and bigtime college football are compatible, but current rules governing major college athletics make it difficult to achieve both. This is the view of Edward T. Foote 2d, president of the University of Miami, and it was expressed today on the eve of what is being billed as the school's biggest football game since Howard Schnellenberger took over as coach in 1979.

title: INTERNATIONAL SHIPHOLDING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After tax credits of $3,422,000 in the qr and $4,622,000 for the 9 mos...C-Net loss...D-Net loss after $2,953,000 after-tax gain from sale of vessles

title: TORIN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Includes tax credits of $59,000 for the qr and $208,000 for the 9 mos

title: SOUTHERN UNION CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
7 MAJOR LAW FIRMS THINKING OF MOVING OFFICES TO TIMES SQ.
description: At least seven of Manhattan's most prominent law firms are thinking of moving to Times Square as part of the proposed multimilliondollar redevelopment of the rundown 42d Street area.

title: SOHIO PLANS OUTLAY OF UP TO $60 BILLION
description: The Standard Oil Company (Ohio) said today that it would spend between $55 billion and $60 billion on capital investments over the next 10 years, with most of the money going into petroleum projects.

title: MARKET FACTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Guidry Classified a Premier Free Agent
description: Ron Guidry, who wants to remain a Yankee and would be a reluctant participant in the free agent draft, is one of only five players eligible to be free agents this fall who would require professional compensation.

title: The Narrow Nobel Prize
description: It is the end of Nobel season, the time each year when the faraway committees in Stockholm and Oslo distribute the world's most influential awards for intellectual achievement. Nations are apt to measure their scientific standing by the number of Nobels awarded to their citizens. The public acknowledges the importance of research through the annual investiture of the new cardinals of science. Yet the way Nobel Prizes are distributed is unjust.

title: No Headline
description: Rockets Win in 2d Overtime

title: AMERICAN NATIONAL INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including investment gains of $2 million or 7 cents a shr for the qr and $8.2 million or 27 cents a shr for the 9 mos... C-Including investment gains of $3.1 million or 10 cents a shr for the qr and $18.7 million or 61 cents a shr for the 9 mos

title: CASCADE STEEL ROLLING MILLS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $1,175,000 extraordinary credit

title: DANCE: BEVERLY BROWN
description: Since Beverly Brown's departure in 1976 from the Erick Hawkins Dance Company, with which she was a lead dancer, Miss Brown has been developing a form of dance in which both movement and its sound accompaniment come most distinctively from the same organic center of the dancer's body. On Thursday, Miss Brown's Dancensemble Theater for Bodies and Voices performed her new and recent work in a program that was at times satisfying, at times disappointing, but always thoughtprovoking.

title: Around the World; Colombia Restricts News About Guerrilla Threats
description: Colombia has ordered radio and television stations to stop carrying reports about public order, and a Government official said today that the action was designed to stop them from becoming ''loudspeakers for subversion.''

title: QUESTIONABLE CLAIMS OF A JOB AUTHORITY
description: To the Editor:

title: ANALYSTS CITE MARATHON'S BIG RESERVES
description: After Du Pont won the battle for Conoco last summer, much of the speculation on potential takeover targets turned to such companies as the Marathon Oil Company, the nation's 17th-largest oil company. Yesterday, many of Wall Street's prophesies were fulfilled when Mobil announced its $5 billion bid for Marathon.

title: I.B.M.'S VENTURE INTO RETAILING
description: Sandwiched between a Thom McAn shoe store and Ginns Office Supply (''Everything for Every Office''), the I.B.M. Product Center, sleek and glass-sheathed, has opened for another day of selling Datamaster 23's and Series III Model 40's and other esoteric items that might befuddle most consumers.

title: WASHINGTON POST SELLS TRENTON TIMES TO ALLBRITTON COMPANY
description: The Trenton Times, which has been owned by The Washington Post Company since 1974, was sold yesterday to Joe L. Allbritton, former owner of The Washington Star. The Trenton newspaper has fought a losing circulation war with the rival Trentonian in recent years.

title: SAUDI ARABIA'S PEACE PLAN AND TEXT OF RESOLUTION 242
description: Following is an unofficial translation from the Arabic of the Middle East peace plan proposed by Crown Prince Fahd of Saudi Arabia and published by the Saudi press agency. It is followed by the text of United Nations Security Council Resolution 242, which was approved Nov. 22, 1967. Saudi Plan

KATY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $87,000 for the qr and $792,000 for the 9 mos...C-Including $404,000 tax credits

title: Sunken Ship's Crew Saved
description: A British freighter, carrying 25 crewmen from a Japanese ship she struck and sank, headed toward Key West today, United States Coast Guard officials said. The Japanese freighter Seiryu sank in 3,500 feet of water this morning, hours after she was struck amidships by the 456-foot freighter Stenna. No injuries were reported to the 53 crew members of either ship.

title: SATURN'S REVOLUTIONS
description: .6,2BALTIMORE - The miraculous Voyager II is now long past Saturn, and despite everything it and Voyager I have told us, the planet, say the astronomers in Pasadena, is more mysterious than ever. This apparently comes as a surprise to scientists. To a student of mythology, is it exactly what one would expect of Saturn, the most thoroughly ambiguous figure in the classical pantheon.

title: BRINK'S ROBBERY CASTS SHADOWS FROM THE PAST
description: The Black Liberation Army, the Republic of New Africa and the Black Panthers - organizations more familiar to the public a decade ago than they are today - have been mentioned by those investigating the Brink's armored car robbery in Rockland County.

title: AMERICAN CENTURY TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to Mar 31
description: B-Includes tax credits of $100,900 for the qr and $604,300 for the 9 mos...C-Includes tax credits of $502,300 for the qr and $2.2 million for the 9 mos

title: Sports People; Oklahoma Rumblings
description: Troubles continue to mount for Coach Barry Switzer at Oklahoma, which is off to a disappointing 3-2-1 start and is apparently having disciplinary problems. Mike Reilly, a defensive end who before the season was considered a strong candidate for all-Big Eight honors, has been dropped by Switzer for missing team meetings, the same infraction that led the coach to drop the star cornerback Darrell Songy last week. Having cut Reilly, Switzer said his players would ''do things right around here or they're not going to be on the football team.''

title: GIBSON-HOMANS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
BIBB CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 26
JETERO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Norfolk State Coach Resigns
description: Lucias Mitchell, the basketball coach at Norfolk State University, resigned today under pressure that was brought about partly by his players' complaints of what they considered demeaning treatment.

title: Reagan Picks Parole Official
description: President Reagan said today that he would nominate Benjamin F. Baer, a parole hearing examiner and former associate warden of San Quentin Prison in California, to be a member of the United States Parole Commission. Other Presidential appointments announced today include that of Charles L. Hardwick, a member of the New Jersey Legislature, to the Presidential Advisory Committee on Federalism, and Warner M. Depuy, president of the First National Bank of Pike County, Pa., to the Susquehanna River Basin Commission.

title: Political Strains Force Walesa To Cancel U.S.-Canada Trip
description: The Polish labor leader Lech Walesa has canceled a scheduled visit to the United States and Canada next month because of increasing tension between the Solidarity union and the Polish Government.

title: Credit Markets; RATES DECLINE BROADLY AGAIN
description: Short- and long-term interest rates declined sharply yesterday for the second straight day, as dealers rushed to buy securities in anticipation of Federal Reserve moves to provide more credit to the financial markets. This would push rates still lower and prices higher.

MULTIFACETED REVIVAL OF A MANHATTAN COMMUNITY
description: To the Editor:

Your Money; 'All Savers': Keeping Up
description: IN England, there is the changing of the guard. In the United States, there is a new phenomenon, the changing of the rate on the ''All Savers'' tax-exempt certificates.

title: FRUIT FLIES' SURVIVAL SETS BACK SCHEDULE FOR ENDING SPRAYING
description: The discovery of two fertile Mediterranean fruit flies in an area laced repeatedly with pesticide has caused alarm among eradication officials and thrown awry plans to wind down the spraying.

title: Around the World; North Korea Says U.S.  Is Violating Its Airspace
description: North Korea said today that two United States fighter-bombers violated its airspace yesterday.

title: NEW-HOME SALES DOWN 12.6%, TO A RECORD LOW
description: Sales of new single-family houses dropped by 12.6 percent in September to the lowest annual rate since the Government began keeping records in 1963, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: A $5 BILLION OFFER FOR MARATHON OIL IS MADE BY MOBIL
description: The Mobil Corporation offered yesterday to pay $5 billion for the Marathon Oil Company, a move that appeared to be the start of a bidding war rivaling last summer's battle for Conoco Inc.
